alert.note: Alert for Clark (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 7:13PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Washington, including the following county, Clark. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 712 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.6 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Burnt Bridge Creek and Lacamas Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Washougal, Vancouver, Camas, Mill Plain, Lacamas Lake, Evergreen, Cascade Park, Ellsworth and McLoughlin Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means creeks are running high and may be out of their banks. Roads in urban or rural areas may have ponding or flooding in low areas.
